item.description:
The Manchester Buddhism Sangha is offering weekly Buddhist meditation and discussion sessions. These take place on Friday evenings, from 6:45 p.m. to 8:15 p.m. Anyone with an interest in beginning or continuing their Buddhist practice is welcome to attend. These meetings will honor all Buddhist traditions. Attendance is free, but if you wish to make a small donation to help defray the expenses for renting the room, that will be appreciated. Your RSVP is required, either via this Meetup site, or by e-mail at dharmastudy@aol.com. 

Enter by: The door on Union Street

Park: On the Street

Please arrive between 6:30-6:45 p.m. (due to security concerns, the door will be locked after 6:50 p.m.)

Other: Please bring your own cushion for meditation, and please remove your shoes in the meditation room. Chairs will be available for anyone who cannot sit on the floor.

The meeting

- 6:55 p.m. - Bell

- Opening chant

- Silent meditation – 30 minutes

- Closing chant

- Bell

- Short break

- Reading followed by discussion (light refreshments provided)

- 8:30 p.m. – meeting ends

Please note: Texts of the chants and the discussion reading will be provided.

The short opening and closing chants are taken from: “Chanting from the Heart” by Thich Nhat Hanh and the Monks and Nuns of Plum Village.

 

Recommended text to learn about basic Buddhist teachings: "What the Buddha Taught” by Walpola Rahula, which is available free on line, in pdf format: http://www.mediafire.com/?d5mz5dztnm4#1
